body:
> When did Solomon do that?

Kings 11

> Adultery is having sex with a woman you're not married to. It's not the same a polygamy. Although I take your point. The Bible references polygamy many times (e.g. Genesis 4:19), but I guess it's debatable that that's an endorsement, and it's fair to argue it's not.

You have to set your eyes on someone and long for them to want to marry them. Longing for someone other than your spouse is adultery. Thus marrying more than once necessarily involves adultery to your first spouse, sparing the possibility of an arranged marriage or some other crazy mishap.

> However, I can never fully know everyone, much less the Pope.

It's still more accurate than race.
body_html:
When did Solomon do that?

Kings 11

Adultery is having sex with a woman you're not married to. It's not the same a polygamy. Although I take your point. The Bible references polygamy many times (e.g. Genesis 4:19), but I guess it's debatable that that's an endorsement, and it's fair to argue it's not.

You have to set your eyes on someone and long for them to want to marry them. Longing for someone other than your spouse is adultery. Thus marrying more than once necessarily involves adultery to your first spouse, sparing the possibility of an arranged marriage or some other crazy mishap.

However, I can never fully know everyone, much less the Pope.

It's still more accurate than race.

post.title: Do racialism and Christianity conflict?

author.bio:

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
> Jesus though plainly had an attitude typical of Jewish chauvinism. He called a Canaanite a dog.

Which are interpolations by Ebionite scribes. Jesus was very kind and ministered to the gentiles, including the most hated races among the Jews, so if this is authentic it would mean he says one thing and does another, which can't be. Actually Jesus himself had partially Moabite blood flowing through his veins, being descended from David, this perhaps being one of the motivations behind the virgin birth fabrication. There's also Roman anti-semitic interpolations, so which is it?

> I think as any rational person realizes though Christianity has existed with and bolstered the most open forms of white supremacy historically. Christianity gets used for so many different things that its form probably assumes the biases, cultural predilections or ideology of those using it as much as anything else. Or it just conforms to the broader culture. Gay pastors, gay marriage, women pastors, etc.

Which is a problem and where all the racist crap comes from. The irony of all those white supremacist anti-semitic "Christians" is that Jesus was thoroughly Jewish, and trying to claim he was a fair haired white European is just as far fetched as black Jesus. I've met very few believers who actually take Jesus seriously (in no way am I good at following either, but they usually don't even care and invent their own god). They're more committed to their myth of "The Bible", a book that God supposedly dropped from the sky containing all the outlandish and contradictory rules for us to point fingers at others for not following, and if you really understand it, which politics to vote for. So you hear a lot about not dancing, women wearing pants, gays, women keeping their place, which politicians are good and bad, fire and brimstone, how wealth and power are good for us but not everyone else, falling birthrates, how beating your wife and kids is perfectly moral, how single people are evil, and out of context quotes from the bible which often aren't even authentic, but rarely is much attention ever devoted to the gospels which are literally the whole point. The ironic part is that the book itself warns repeatedly against all this hypocrisy. We might as well start calling ourselves pharisees.
body_html:
Jesus though plainly had an attitude typical of Jewish chauvinism. He called a Canaanite a dog.

Which are interpolations by Ebionite scribes. Jesus was very kind and ministered to the gentiles, including the most hated races among the Jews, so if this is authentic it would mean he says one thing and does another, which can't be. Actually Jesus himself had partially Moabite blood flowing through his veins, being descended from David, this perhaps being one of the motivations behind the virgin birth fabrication. There's also Roman anti-semitic interpolations, so which is it?

I think as any rational person realizes though Christianity has existed with and bolstered the most open forms of white supremacy historically. Christianity gets used for so many different things that its form probably assumes the biases, cultural predilections or ideology of those using it as much as anything else. Or it just conforms to the broader culture. Gay pastors, gay marriage, women pastors, etc.

Which is a problem and where all the racist crap comes from. The irony of all those white supremacist anti-semitic "Christians" is that Jesus was thoroughly Jewish, and trying to claim he was a fair haired white European is just as far fetched as black Jesus. I've met very few believers who actually take Jesus seriously (in no way am I good at following either, but they usually don't even care and invent their own god). They're more committed to their myth of "The Bible", a book that God supposedly dropped from the sky containing all the outlandish and contradictory rules for us to point fingers at others for not following, and if you really understand it, which politics to vote for. So you hear a lot about not dancing, women wearing pants, gays, women keeping their place, which politicians are good and bad, fire and brimstone, how wealth and power are good for us but not everyone else, falling birthrates, how beating your wife and kids is perfectly moral, how single people are evil, and out of context quotes from the bible which often aren't even authentic, but rarely is much attention ever devoted to the gospels which are literally the whole point. The ironic part is that the book itself warns repeatedly against all this hypocrisy. We might as well start calling ourselves pharisees.

I mean, Nathan Bedford Forrest, the first leader of the Klan, was nice to blacks too - depending on which time period you want to point to. But Jesus could very easily be called a straight up bigot.

I think as any rational person realizes though Christianity has existed with and bolstered the most open forms of white supremacy historically. Christianity gets used for so many different things that its form probably assumes the biases, cultural predilections or ideology of those using it as much as anything else. Or it just conforms to the broader culture. Gay pastors, gay marriage, women pastors, etc.

post.title: Do racialism and Christianity conflict?

author.bio:

body:
> And now today, a Christian who merely believes in traditional gender roles is considered radical by some. Polygamy is explicitly condoned in the Bible, yet any Christian still practicing it today considered radical by most other Christians, but ironically, not by most leftists, who see polygamy as natural and liberating...unless it's done by Christians, and then it's an evil tool of a patriarchy used to abuse women...

Polygamy is absolutely not condoned, and it was actually the flaw that led Solomon to build temples for false gods. And desiring a woman other than your wife is adultery, and how can you marry someone without first desiring them (unless it's arranged)? There are a few passages praising polygamy but all of these are either from an anonymous author who easily would've not realized it or is a later addition by people with an agenda. All the "gender roles" crap in the new testament is also later additions, they aren't even in context, or they come from fake letters by the church fathers. And the "roles" are basically "women are pieces of meat good for nothing but being fucked by men and having their kids for them" which is definitely not the attitude that the real people in the new testament had, as you can clearly see by their actions. The old testament too actually.

> I don't hate all Blacks, as you seem to, but I can sympathize with not wanting my religious leader to be part of a wider race or culture I share nothing in common with.

Does it have to matter? Why are so many "Christians" so obsessed with categorizing people based on their biological makeup when they're supposed to be focused on spiritual matters?
body_html:
And now today, a Christian who merely believes in traditional gender roles is considered radical by some. Polygamy is explicitly condoned in the Bible, yet any Christian still practicing it today considered radical by most other Christians, but ironically, not by most leftists, who see polygamy as natural and liberating...unless it's done by Christians, and then it's an evil tool of a patriarchy used to abuse women...

Polygamy is absolutely not condoned, and it was actually the flaw that led Solomon to build temples for false gods. And desiring a woman other than your wife is adultery, and how can you marry someone without first desiring them (unless it's arranged)? There are a few passages praising polygamy but all of these are either from an anonymous author who easily would've not realized it or is a later addition by people with an agenda. All the "gender roles" crap in the new testament is also later additions, they aren't even in context, or they come from fake letters by the church fathers. And the "roles" are basically "women are pieces of meat good for nothing but being fucked by men and having their kids for them" which is definitely not the attitude that the real people in the new testament had, as you can clearly see by their actions. The old testament too actually.

I don't hate all Blacks, as you seem to, but I can sympathize with not wanting my religious leader to be part of a wider race or culture I share nothing in common with.

Does it have to matter? Why are so many "Christians" so obsessed with categorizing people based on their biological makeup when they're supposed to be focused on spiritual matters?

body:
> Christian: the nation should be Christian.

Not correct. There is no such thing as a "Christian nation" and there never will be. God in fact felt rejected when the Israelites demanded a human king and secular government.
body_html:
Christian: the nation should be Christian.

Not correct. There is no such thing as a "Christian nation" and there never will be. God in fact felt rejected when the Israelites demanded a human king and secular government.

parent.body:
Let's take an example to illustrate the point of extremes to avoid: marrying. It's ok for Christians to marry Christians of other races than theirs, so-called "race-mixing" is ok (but it seems as a general rule, people marry from their own race statistically - [it's around 90% currently I think](https://www.census.gov/library/stories/2018/07/interracial-marriages.html)). Saying that someone is "racist" unless they mix races, I think would not be acceptable for Christians ("far left"). Saying that a person must not "mix races" would also be wrong ("far right"). Christians are against "religion mixing" as a general rule, instead Christians are supposed to marry Christians and avoid marrying nonbelievers (Christian standard that admits some exceptions but does not encourage them). 

Another example: the goal of the nation. Christian: the nation should be Christian. "Far-Right": the nation should be a specific race or culture. "Far-Left": there should be no nation, or no national religion. (It's possible for there to be no nation, or no national religion, or for the nation to be a specific race, but these are not as important as the nation or a person being Christian).

Do these two examples illustrate the issue?
parent.body_html:
Let's take an example to illustrate the point of extremes to avoid: marrying. It's ok for Christians to marry Christians of other races than theirs, so-called "race-mixing" is ok (but it seems as a general rule, people marry from their own race statistically - it's around 90% currently I think). Saying that someone is "racist" unless they mix races, I think would not be acceptable for Christians ("far left"). Saying that a person must not "mix races" would also be wrong ("far right"). Christians are against "religion mixing" as a general rule, instead Christians are supposed to marry Christians and avoid marrying nonbelievers (Christian standard that admits some exceptions but does not encourage them).

Another example: the goal of the nation. Christian: the nation should be Christian. "Far-Right": the nation should be a specific race or culture. "Far-Left": there should be no nation, or no national religion. (It's possible for there to be no nation, or no national religion, or for the nation to be a specific race, but these are not as important as the nation or a person being Christian).

Do these two examples illustrate the issue?

body:
> If you think white America going extinct is simply unimportant we probably have nothing really interesting to say to each other on that issue.

I seriously doubt white people will go extinct. They've been around for a very long time. Even if they did, so what?

> You only partially quoted that passage though. He seems to be saying you will be cast into hell if you lust. Everyone lusts so it seems on the surface to not be a particularly rational expectation. But I do think Jesus was rational so he probably had a more nuanced meaning. Perhaps wife specifically rather than lusting after women in general. That has been one suggestion.

You're correct, "lust" is a mistranslation like many others motivated by our current puritanical sex culture and he actually said "longing for her", wishing she would be his wife instead of his own wife. The only way this can be important is if the husband's loyalty to his wife is important, meaning she matters and is not just his stupid slave piece of meat for sexual gratification like so many preach. The next passage on divorce repeats this. Note that this targets men making wives the victims of adultery, so the bullshit that some say "men are allowed to commit adultery, only women have to be loyal" is an outright lie. Also he's not saying you go to hell, first of all hell probably doesn't exist, and secondly remember the parable of the pharisee and the tax collector. If this keeps you out of heaven then David and Solomon and most of the old testament fathers won't be there, and the crucifixion was for nothing. Gehenna was a valley in new testament times where Jews burned garbage all day and all night, not hell. It's an allusion to what they *deserve*, and if you deserve death for something of course you should feel that guilty for it. And the point is also that everyone deserves it because perfection is impossible for our fallen nature to attain, not necessarily this action specifically but at least something.

> In that case it does me no harm to want to see a 21 year old Britney Spears in Playboy.

Your comment sounded like singing wasn't keeping her "woman's place" and women belong being used by men and not doing their own thing.
body_html:
If you think white America going extinct is simply unimportant we probably have nothing really interesting to say to each other on that issue.

I seriously doubt white people will go extinct. They've been around for a very long time. Even if they did, so what?

You only partially quoted that passage though. He seems to be saying you will be cast into hell if you lust. Everyone lusts so it seems on the surface to not be a particularly rational expectation. But I do think Jesus was rational so he probably had a more nuanced meaning. Perhaps wife specifically rather than lusting after women in general. That has been one suggestion.

You're correct, "lust" is a mistranslation like many others motivated by our current puritanical sex culture and he actually said "longing for her", wishing she would be his wife instead of his own wife. The only way this can be important is if the husband's loyalty to his wife is important, meaning she matters and is not just his stupid slave piece of meat for sexual gratification like so many preach. The next passage on divorce repeats this. Note that this targets men making wives the victims of adultery, so the bullshit that some say "men are allowed to commit adultery, only women have to be loyal" is an outright lie. Also he's not saying you go to hell, first of all hell probably doesn't exist, and secondly remember the parable of the pharisee and the tax collector. If this keeps you out of heaven then David and Solomon and most of the old testament fathers won't be there, and the crucifixion was for nothing. Gehenna was a valley in new testament times where Jews burned garbage all day and all night, not hell. It's an allusion to what they deserve, and if you deserve death for something of course you should feel that guilty for it. And the point is also that everyone deserves it because perfection is impossible for our fallen nature to attain, not necessarily this action specifically but at least something.

In that case it does me no harm to want to see a 21 year old Britney Spears in Playboy.

Your comment sounded like singing wasn't keeping her "woman's place" and women belong being used by men and not doing their own thing.

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.
guild.description_html:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God.

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

parent.body:
If you think white America going extinct is simply unimportant we probably have nothing really interesting to say to each other on that issue.

You only partially quoted that passage though. He seems to be saying you will be cast into hell if you lust. Everyone lusts so it seems on the surface to not be a particularly rational expectation. But I do think Jesus was rational so he probably had a more nuanced meaning. Perhaps wife specifically rather than lusting after women in general. That has been one suggestion. In that case it does a man no harm theoretically to want to see a 21 year old Britney Spears in Playboy. She was single. Even so - men are going to lust after married women too.

body:
> Racial annihilation is a serious concern. You have to be naive to not think it is.

That's not annihilation, that's reproduction. Annihilation is what Hitler tried to do to the Jewish race. The reason races exist in the first place is because people with different genetic makeups had kids and repeat. Not sure why it matters though.

> It wasn't my intention in this thread to discuss Jesus or scripture though. Nor to be given a lecture or sermon for that matter. If you ask me his comments on lust in Matthew seem strange - which gives rise to the idea he may have not meant what is commonly thought.

Well, let's see.

"You've heard it said 'Do not commit adultery'. But I tell you that everyone who looks at a woman longing for her has already committed adultery with her in his heart".

This is quite clear. The wife's feelings and sexual life matter. A man cannot just be disloyal and have sex whenever he wants with whoever he wants. Women weren't created to be sex objects for mens' pleasure. Otherwise "heart adultery" wouldn't matter.

It wasn't my intention in this thread to discuss Jesus or scripture though. Nor to be given a lecture or sermon for that matter. If you ask me his comments on lust in Matthew seem strange - which gives rise to the idea he may have not meant what is commonly thought.

This is quite clear. The wife's feelings and sexual life matter. A man cannot just be disloyal and have sex whenever he wants with whoever he wants. Women weren't created to be sex objects for mens' pleasure. Otherwise "heart adultery" wouldn't matter.

parent.body:
Racial annihilation is a serious concern. You have to be naive to not think it is.

It wasn't my intention in this thread to discuss Jesus or scripture though. Nor to be given a lecture or sermon for that matter. If you ask me though his comments on lust in Matthew or wherever it is seem strange - which gives rise to the idea he may have not meant what is commonly thought.
parent.body_html:
Racial annihilation is a serious concern. You have to be naive to not think it is.

It wasn't my intention in this thread to discuss Jesus or scripture though. Nor to be given a lecture or sermon for that matter. If you ask me though his comments on lust in Matthew or wherever it is seem strange - which gives rise to the idea he may have not meant what is commonly thought.

body:
Not being uptight about sex doesn't mean women are sex objects. I'm not particularly puritanic myself. But your comment implied that you think any woman who has pursuits other than being an object of sexual pleasure for men is not keeping her place. How would you feel if women thought that about you? I may have misinterpreted but that's what it sounded like.

And besides, you were just complaining about interracial marrying "rising to worrying rates", if that's not uptight I don't know what is. You were also complaining about other things considered taboo in most churches. But the one thing Jesus actually does call out is apparently the one that's okay.

I may have misinterpreted but that's what it sounded like.

And besides, you were just complaining about interracial marrying "rising to worrying rates", if that's not uptight I don't know what is. You were also complaining about other things considered taboo in most churches. But the one thing Jesus actually does call out is apparently the one that's okay.

post.body:
So today is a huge day for me; yes I'm new to Ruqqus. But today also markes 5 years with the Lord Jesus Christ and wow what a whirlwind it was. I don't wanna go into details just because some people might be offended.... but I did come out of being involved in Luciferianism and Satanism... and it took a wonderful woman almost a year of ministry to finally help see the Light of our King...

I have been soo thankful for her; and all that God has done for me. I have been a Christian since March 1, 2016. Thank the Lord... In a few months I'll finish up seminary!

body: It is. Fundy is actually the best example right now because he's the newest channel, and you can clearly see that he only has about 30 videos all of which date to the past year. Dream did the exact same thing but he's a lot older and it's not as noticeable anymore. But you can see how each of them gets like 3 slots at the top of everyones' suggestions. While everyone else hardly ever even gets one unless you watch them a lot already, and people with 10x more subscribers than them don't get anywhere near as many views.
body_html: It is. Fundy is actually the best example right now because he's the newest channel, and you can clearly see that he only has about 30 videos all of which date to the past year. Dream did the exact same thing but he's a lot older and it's not as noticeable anymore. But you can see how each of them gets like 3 slots at the top of everyones' suggestions. While everyone else hardly ever even gets one unless you watch them a lot already, and people with 10x more subscribers than them don't get anywhere near as many views.

guild.description: For all your conspiracy theories.
guild.description_html: For all your conspiracy theories.
guild.name: Conspiracy

parent.body: I don't watch minecraft videos, but when I heard about Dream through the speedrun cheating scandal, I did notice that their growth seemed rather suspicious.
parent.body_html: I don't watch minecraft videos, but when I heard about Dream through the speedrun cheating scandal, I did notice that their growth seemed rather suspicious.

post.body:
I first started noticing this when Dream, and his associates George, Fundy, etc. all started getting millions of views on every single video, without a *single* failure. Their videos are thrown all through everyones' suggestions at an absurd rate. Some of them only have like 20 videos total and have almost 3 million subscribers, which they gained from 0 in *less than a year*.

As you can tell this is beyond absurd. Even the biggest YouTubers of all time are nowhere close to that. And youtube has been known to have industry plants, the most famous example being that girl who lives in a van. I've known this since July.

However there's been other very weird activity lately concerning other youtubers. Right as this started happening, all the other major minecraft channels went kinda dormant or even completely quit. Most of the ones that didn't got demonetized, terminated, or forced to rebrand.

What little activity these channels do have though, is *worshipping Dream and his associates*. This is way too big of a coincidence. If Dream is being employed by YouTube as I suspect they are, then it's not too big of a stretch to think that maybe YouTube or Dream is bribing the others to quit so the Dream Team gets more of the spotlight.

Even popular channels outside of the minecraft realm are susceptible to this. In the past year alone, not only did nearly every popular minecraft channel quit at the same time, but SMG4 went more cringe than ever and started promoting Dream, SuperMarioLogan got a cease and desist and is likely to get terminated, tons of popular channels got terminated, and the ones that are left either quit or started worshipping Dream like crazy. ExplodingTNT "took a break" and Pink Sheep's videos suddenly went from hilarious to so cringe it had to have been on purpose, all at the exact same time he started shilling for Dream, and at the exact same time every other MC channel did the same thing.

post.title: Dream is a paid shill and employee of YouTube/Google

body:
1. firexq protested against the banning of loli guilds and was banned for "cp" despite the fact that he never posted cp. This was later reversed.

2. DGKSK8LIFE was banned with a loophole. The admins for some reason had promoted him to part of their core coding team, and he put it on his profile. However, after they got into fights with each other captainmeta4 removed him from this position, then *perma*banned him for "impersonation" because he hadn't updated his profile within 1 nanosecond of being demoted.

3. klenvastergan was banned for "spam" because the admins found his posts unfunny. Before that he was also banned for modding > 10 guilds, after the admins specifically made that a rule on the fly so they could ban him.

4. JosephGoebbels was apparently permabanned for "modding more than 10 guilds" which he says he never did. The admins secretly told the discord mods and RCP about it so they could immediately go and siege his guilds. This was reversed after being called out. It was also found that 2 of the discord users who sieged his guilds were evading the cooldown, which the admins reluctantly gave a *one day* ban for.

5. Xigbar68 and DarkForge were banned for "harassment" for calling out the RCP and the admins' special treatment of discord mods. I was also threatened with the same ban twice. Meanwhile the discord VIPs continued to go around telling everyone to kill themselves with no consequences.

6. sfrohne was permabanned for "cp" after reposting someone else's post that contained a link to a *google search* about child pornography. Cap himself then posted a screenshot of that post *uncensored* on discord, which he and his discord buddies continued to share both on discord and ruqqus with no repercussions.
body_html:
1. firexq protested against the banning of loli guilds and was banned for "cp" despite the fact that he never posted cp. This was later reversed.

  2. DGKSK8LIFE was banned with a loophole. The admins for some reason had promoted him to part of their core coding team, and he put it on his profile. However, after they got into fights with each other captainmeta4 removed him from this position, then permabanned him for "impersonation" because he hadn't updated his profile within 1 nanosecond of being demoted.

  3. klenvastergan was banned for "spam" because the admins found his posts unfunny. Before that he was also banned for modding > 10 guilds, after the admins specifically made that a rule on the fly so they could ban him.

  4. JosephGoebbels was apparently permabanned for "modding more than 10 guilds" which he says he never did. The admins secretly told the discord mods and RCP about it so they could immediately go and siege his guilds. This was reversed after being called out. It was also found that 2 of the discord users who sieged his guilds were evading the cooldown, which the admins reluctantly gave a one day ban for.

  5. Xigbar68 and DarkForge were banned for "harassment" for calling out the RCP and the admins' special treatment of discord mods. I was also threatened with the same ban twice. Meanwhile the discord VIPs continued to go around telling everyone to kill themselves with no consequences.

  6. sfrohne was permabanned for "cp" after reposting someone else's post that contained a link to a google search about child pornography. Cap himself then posted a screenshot of that post uncensored on discord, which he and his discord buddies continued to share both on discord and ruqqus with no repercussions.

guild.description:
Here we go again...

![](https://i.ruqqus.com/post/66iv/ee_ubwXLfNg)

*Cabal*: n. the contrived schemes of a group of persons secretly united in a plot - also: a group engaged in such schemes.

*Powermod*: n. [short for power moderator] a person of power, usually a moderator on a structured website, that takes too many unpopulist stances

This guild is dedicated to whistleblowing and preventing powermods and the forming of a powermod oligarchy which would censor opinions and lead Ruqqus into the same corruption that is killing Reddit.
